Compute rolling annualized tracking differences (CAGR or log-return)

Source: R/fund_calc.R
roll_diffs.Rd

For each fund–index pair in fund_index_map, computes a rolling, annualized tracking-difference series over a backward window of n_days. The result is added as new columns named <fund>_rd.

Usage

roll_diffs(
  df,
  n_days,
  fund_index_map,
  date_col = "date",
  use_log = TRUE,
  annual_days = 365,
  silent_skip = FALSE
)

Arguments

df

Data frame containing the date column, fund columns, and benchmark/index columns referenced in fund_index_map.

n_days

Rolling lookback window in calendar days.

fund_index_map

Named character vector mapping fund column names to their corresponding benchmark/index column names.

date_col

Name of the date column in df. Defaults to "date".

use_log

Logical; if TRUE, computes log-return tracking differences. If FALSE, computes CAGR tracking differences. Defaults to TRUE.

annual_days

Number of days used for annualization. Defaults to 365.

silent_skip

Logical; whether to show messages when skipping funds that are in fund_index_map but not in df. Defaults to FALSE.

Value

A data frame like df with one additional column per fund, named <fund>_rd, containing the rolling tracking differences.

Details

For each fund–index pair, the function locates a start point n_days (or more) before each observation and computes:

  • log-return difference $$ ( \ln(f_{t}/f_{t_0}) - \ln(i_{t}/i_{t_0}) ) \times \frac{annual\_days}{t - t_0} $$

  • CAGR difference $$ f^{annual\_days/(t - t_0)} - i^{annual\_days/(t - t_0)} $$

where \(f\) and \(i\) are fund and index values, respectively.

The tracking difference is NA whenever the anchor point is missing, the values are invalid (e.g., non-positive for log mode), or no past observation lies within the required window.
